dialogue.text: You're just staring down the staircase of cognition and going, "Realistically, I can only climb a few steps before I drop the flashlight."

psychological_notes: The architect introduces another metaphor - cognition as a staircase where we inevitably 'drop the flashlight.' This validates Evan's realistic self-assessment while acknowledging the darkness beyond our cognitive reach. The image captures both achievement (climbing some steps) and limitation (can't climb forever).
philosophical_underpinning: Wisdom as knowing the limits of knowing
